mickel.anim
Class Stage

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      mickel.anim.Stage
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public class Stage
extends JFrame

A GUI window containing an animated screen. A Stage serves as a container for Sprite objects that can be displayed and animated.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Stage

public Stage(String title,
             int width,
             int height)
Creates a window containing an animated canvas. Sprite objects added to this Stage will be drawn into the window and animated. By default, when a new Stage is constructed, it is not immediately visible or actively running. After initializing all of the properties of the Stage (e.g., background color/image, etc.), you should invoke the openWindow() and start() methods.

Stage s = new Stage("title", width, height);
...additional initializations...
s.openWindow(); // Makes the window visible
s.start(); // Starts the animation

Parameters:
title - The text to be displayed in the window's title bar
width - The width of the window
height - The height of the window

Stage

public Stage(String title,
             int width,
             int height,
             int fps)
Creates a window containing an animated canvas. Sprite objects added to this Stage will be drawn into the window and animated. By default, when a new Stage is constructed, it is not immediately visible or actively running. After initializing all of the properties of the Stage (e.g., background color/image, etc.), you should invoke the openWindow() and start() methods.

Stage s = new Stage("title", width, height);
...additional initializations...
s.openWindow(); // Makes the window visible
s.start(); // Starts the animation

Parameters:
title - The text to be displayed in the window's title bar
width - The width of the window
height - The height of the window
fps - Milliseconds of delay between frames of animation

closeWindow

public void closeWindow()
Closes the GUI window for this Stage.

getFrameRate

public int getFrameRate()
Gets the current, maximum number of frames per second to be achieved by the animation.

Returns:
The maximum number of frames of animation per second that can be achieved

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Gets the height of the Stage window.

Overrides:
getHeight in class Component
Returns:
The height of the window

getSprites

public List<Sprite> getSprites(String className)
Gets a list of all sprites in this Stage that are of a given class. The order of the list is the same as the order in which the sprites are currently layered in this Stage (i.e., from "back" to "front").

Parameters:
className - The name of the desired class
Returns:
A list of all sprites in this Stage of the desired class

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Gets the width of the Stage window.

Overrides:
getWidth in class Component
Returns:
The width of the window

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Determines whether or not the Stage is currently animating its Sprites. The default state for a newly constructed window is "stopped".

Returns:
true if the animation is running, false if it is stopped

moveBackward

public void moveBackward(Sprite s)
Moves a Sprite farther into the "background" of the Stage.

Parameters:
s - The Sprite to be moved backward

moveForward

public void moveForward(Sprite s)
Moves a Sprite closer to the "foreground" of the Stage.

Parameters:
s - The Sprite to be moved forward

moveToBack

public void moveToBack(Sprite s)
Moves a Sprite to the rear-most layer of the Stage.

Parameters:
s - The Sprite to be moved to back

moveToFront

public void moveToFront(Sprite s)
Moves a Sprite to the front-most layer of the Stage.

Parameters:
s - The Sprite to be moved to front

openWindow

public void openWindow()
Opens the GUI window for this Stage. The default state for a newly constructed window is "closed".

paint

public void paint(Graphics g)
Cycles through another frame of animation by instructing all of its Sprite objects to perform their act() and draw() methods and then updating the screen display accordingly.

NOTE: This method is invoked automatically by the operating system. Do not try to invoke it directly. If you have the need to do so, invoke the Stage's repaint() method instead.

Overrides:
paint in class Container
Parameters:
g - The Graphics context for this window

remove

public void remove(Sprite s)
Removes a Sprite from the Stage.

Parameters:
s - The Sprite to be removed from the Stage

setBackground

public void setBackground(Color color)
Assigns a background color to the Stage window.

Overrides:
setBackground in class Component
Parameters:
color - The Color of the window's background

setBackground

public void setBackground(ImageFile file)
Assigns an image file to be used as the background of the Stage window.

Parameters:
file - The ImageFile to be used as a background

setFrameRate

public void setFrameRate(int fps)
Assigns the maximum number of frames per second to be achieved by the animation. A negative value will default to the maximum frame rate of 1000 frames per second.

Parameters:
fps - Frames of animation per second

start

public void start()
Starts animating the contents of the Stage window. All contained Sprite objects will be instructed to draw()act(). The default state for a newly constructed window is "stopped".

stop

public void stop()
Stops all animation in the Stage window.
